Four Pu-241 targets prepared by IRMM:
1-st was used at measurement of binary fission;
4-th was used to exactly measure the energy
distribution of helium isotopes down to 3 MeV;
2-nd and 3-rd served for measurement of ternary fission
At the time of the measurements for three targets about
20%, 31%, 28% respectively of the Pu-241 had decayed to
Am-241, but during two weeks of measurement the
contribution of other fissile isotopes (e.g. from
bred Am-242(n,f)) will stay below 6%. The last target
was used 9 months after plutonium separation, thus
limiting contributions from other fissile systems
